      • BayesianDefaultFactor

        public BayesianDefaultFactor​(BayesianFactor factor)
        This creates a new factor with the same domain and the data of the given factor. Data are recovered using the getValueAt(int) method, they will not be in log-space, and they will follow the same domain of the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to construct the new factor from

      • marginalize

        public BayesianDefaultFactor marginalize​(int variable)

        Marginalize a variable out of the factor. This corresponds to sum all parameters that differ only in the state of the marginalized variable.

        If this factor represent a Conditional Probability Table you should only marginalize variables on the right side of the conditioning bar. If so, there is no need for further normalization.

        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        marginalize in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable to be summed out of the CPT
        Returns:
        a new BayesianDefaultFactor with the variable marginalized out.

      • combineIterator

        public BayesianDefaultFactor combineIterator​(BayesianDefaultFactor cpt)
        Combine the provided factor with this one.

      • combine

        public BayesianDefaultFactor combine​(BayesianFactor factor)
        The specialized method that avoids the cast of the input variable.

        This implementation uses long values for strides, sizes and indices, allowing for combined operations. Increasing the index is, for instance, one single add instead of two. The values will contain in the Lower 32bit this factor's values and in the upper 32 the parameter's ones. Given that most architectures are 64 bit, this should give a tiny performance improvement.

        If the input factor is also a BayesianDefaultFactor, a fast algebra i used. If the input is a BayesianLogFactor, the factor will be first converted in the normal-space.

        Specified by:
        combine in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        combine in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        combine in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - input factor
        Returns:
        a BayesianDefaultFactor, combination of the this with the other factor

      • addition

        public BayesianDefaultFactor addition​(BayesianFactor factor)
        The specialized method that avoids the cast of the input variable.

        This implementation uses long values for strides, sizes and indices, allowing for combined operations. Increasing the index is, for instance, one single add instead of two. The values will contain in the Lower 32bit this factor's values and in the upper 32 the parameter's ones. Given that most architectures are 64 bit, this should give a tiny performance improvement.

        If the input factor is also a BayesianDefaultFactor, a fast algebra i used. If the input is a BayesianLogFactor, the factor will be first converted in the normal-space.

        Specified by:
        addition in interface BayesianFactor
        Overrides:
        addition in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - input factor
        Returns:
        a BayesianDefaultFactor, sum of the probabilities of this with the input factor

      • divide

        public BayesianDefaultFactor divide​(BayesianFactor factor)

        If the input factor is also a BayesianDefaultFactor, a fast algebra i used. If the input is a BayesianLogFactor, the factor will be first converted in the normal-space.

        Specified by:
        divide in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        divide in class BayesianAbstractFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - input factor
        Returns:
        a BayesianDefaultFactor, division of this factor with the other one

        public ObservationBuilder sample()
